@Grimeandreason @dmonett @Grady_Booch That's right, scientists cite prior work and work they were influenced by.
But artists *do* build on others' work without mentioning them.
@Grady_Booch @DavidRimshnick @adawan919 @Oatmeal Exactly.

@Ket_Cherie @marklemley @pavel_soukenik We can argue about the level of creativity of generative models, but they *do* create artifacts that are substantially different from what they were trained on.
The originality of their production may be on par with that of run-of-the-mill human artists.

@Grady_Booch @adawan919 Gauguin was pretty well off from his work, Toulouse-Lautrec was from a wealthy aristocratic family. The others may have died pennyless, but not because their art was copied (or perhaps even appreciated) during their lifetime.

@marcotrombetti Proving someone wrong with a good theory, experimental evidence, or just a good substantial argument, is an integral part of the process of science.
But twisting someone's arguments in an attempt to prove them wrong is just counterproductive trolling.
@Grady_Booch @adawan919 I tend to think that when a piece is being widely imitated, the effect is to make the original more valuable, not less.

Tune in as I deliver remarks on additional actions to lower costs and strengthen energy security. https://t.co/mpd1G1vCGT

It‚Äôs simple: When the cost of oil comes down, we should see the price at the pump come down as well. That‚Äôs how it should work.
 
But right now, refiners and retailers are making record profits at the expense of the vast majority of Americans. It‚Äôs unacceptable. https://t.co/h3xiyEYEdv
Republican officials are doing everything they can to deny student loan debt relief to hardworking Americas ‚Äì even to their own constituents. https://t.co/A2W1hc5z8Z

Republicans in Congress aren't just looking to get rid of the Inflation Reduction Act. They are still determined to repeal the Affordable Care Act. 
 
That means an end to protections for tens of millions of people with pre-existing conditions who rely on the ACA.
I said it then and I'll say it now: the decision on Roe wasn't going to stop with a woman's right to choose. https://t.co/YkGZKx2PFB

Americans are going to start seeing hearing aids on their store shelves.

That‚Äôs a big deal.

Thanks to the Inflation Reduction Act, if Big Pharma tries to raise drug prices faster than inflation, they‚Äôll have to write a check to Medicare to cover the difference.

Instead of that money going to drug companies, it‚Äôll go in folks' pockets in the form of lower drug prices.

Student loan debt relief is a game changer for millions.

Get moving: https://t.co/DYpFtPY70p. https://t.co/JfqykMBJB3

We must do more to transform how we address mental health.

My Administration is announcing funding to expand Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinics ‚Äì centers that deliver mental health and substance use care to folks who need it, no matter who they are or if they can pay.

Working people and the middle class will benefit from my Administration's student loan debt relief.
 
Not those at the top.

More than 40 million Americans stand to benefit from our student loan debt relief. Nearly 20 million of them could see their debts canceled. About 90% will go to those making under $75,000 a year.

And not a dime will go to those in the top 5% of incomes. Period.

We‚Äôve invested in infrastructure.
Jobs.
Lower costs.
Manufacturing.
Health care.

And we‚Äôre not stopping anytime soon. https://t.co/CKVyR6WBQO

Most families are focused on putting three meals on the table, taking care of their kids, and paying their bills.

Helping you do that is my job. https://t.co/Z8KUZc6mkm

Today's opening of the student loan debt relief application marks a big step, among others that my Administration is taking, to make education a ticket to the middle class that folks can actually afford. https://t.co/qagQXWx8mo

Apply today and share with others.

https://t.co/WFCPfWoLhi https://t.co/ZMWySfS5hl

Folks, apply for student loan debt relief today.

No forms.
No special log-in.
It‚Äôs available in English and Spanish ‚Äì and on desktop and mobile.
 
And it'll take you less than 5 minutes. https://t.co/WFCPfWoLhi

My commitment if elected president was to make government work and deliver for the people.
 
Bringing student loan debt relief to folks that need it most as they recover from the pandemic and prepare to restart loan payments keeps that commitment.

I recently announced my Administration‚Äôs plan to relieve up to $20,000 in student loan debt if you received a Pell Grant and up to $10,000 if you didn‚Äôt.
 
Today, I‚Äôm announcing how working- and middle-class folks can apply for that relief.
 
Go to https://t.co/WFCPfWoLhi.
Tune in as I provide an update on student loan debt relief. https://t.co/hBBcdmDMmk
When it actually came time to do something about inflation around the kitchen table, Republicans in Congress voted against the Inflation Reduction Act. https://t.co/QHS2G0lshX

Americans are squeezed by the cost of living yet Republicans in Congress‚Äô number one priority is repealing a historic investment in lowering costs ‚Äì the Inflation Reduction Act.

It‚Äôs the exact wrong thing to do in this moment.

Starting this week, we're making hearing aids available over the counter, so people don't have to pay for expensive visits to specialists. 
 
The FDA estimates this is going to save patients as much as $3,000 per pair.

The progress we‚Äôve made making health care more affordable is one of the reasons why I‚Äôm so optimistic about America‚Äôs future.

We‚Äôre making real progress helping folks get just a little more breathing room.

If Republicans in Congress have their way, it means the power we just gave Medicare to negotiate for lower prescription drug costs goes away. 
 
The $2,000 cap on prescription drug costs for seniors? Gone. 
 
The $35 a month cap on insulin for folks on Medicare? Gone.

It only costs $10 to make a bottle of insulin. But drug companies charge some families 30 times more than that.
 
Republicans in Congress blocked our attempt to cap insulin costs for every American.

Some drug companies charge families 30 times more than what it costs to make a bottle of insulin.
 
Imagine being a parent, needing insulin for your child, and not having the money.
 
We're going to keep fighting to lower the cost of life-saving insulin for children and families.
Instead of ‚ÄúInfrastructure Week‚Äù being a punch line under my predecessor, ‚ÄúInfrastructure Decade‚Äù is a headline on my watch. https://t.co/2cFe7p9Xrd

I ran for president to give the middle class some breathing room in dealing with costs. But despite our progress, prices are still too high.
 
That's why we passed the Inflation Reduction Act to combat health care costs and other price pressures squeezing America's families.

America is reasserting ourselves as a leader in infrastructure.
 
We‚Äôre proving our best days are ahead of us. https://t.co/ykCJt8vhjH

Last year, we saved a family of four with health coverage through the Affordable Care Act an average of $2,400.
 
This year, we're locking in place those lower health care premiums for millions of families with the Inflation Reduction Act.

If Republicans in Congress get their way, prices will go up and inflation will get worse.  
 
It‚Äôs that simple.

Today marks the beginning of Medicare's open enrollment period.

So when seniors pick plans for next year, they will be able to take advantage of the progress we've made ‚Äì lower premiums because of the Inflation Reduction Act. https://t.co/typx1Id7su

We pay more for our prescription drugs than any other nation in the world. It's outrageous.
